titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the Attorney General should be an elected officer of the Federal Government.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 8/6/1998--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the Attorney General should be an elected officer of the Federal Government; and (2) the Congress should propose an amendment to the Constitution providing for the independent election of the Attorney General.
